isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CATERPILLAR C-10 AND C-12 ENGINES - TROUBLESHOOTING - Determining Fault Codes

svcprocinfo.para: The EZ-Tech™, PRO-LINK 9000®, or Caterpillar electronic service tools (EST) can be used to identify logged fault codes. Refer to the EST manual for operating instructions.
The yellow Serv/Check Engine light can be used to read fault codes by following the procedure in the following paragraph.

note.para: All Caterpillar flash codes are two digit numbers.

step1.para: Turn the key to the on position. The yellow Serv/Check Engine light will turn on for approximately five seconds, then turn off for several more seconds, then begins to FLASH any logged codes.
The yellow Serv/Check Engine light will FLASH the first digit. At the end of first digit there is a one or two second pause.
The yellow Serv/Check Engine light will FLASH the second digit. At the end of the second digit there will be a two or three second pause before the next fault code number is FLASHED.
The second and all successive fault codes will FLASH until all codes have been FLASHED. It will stop FLASHING after the last code has been flashed. To see the fault codes again, repeat the process.

Flash code 55 indicates that there are no logged diagnostic codes. For a listing of Caterpillar Flash codes, refer to the Caterpillar Electronic Troubleshooting manual. Codes are also listed in the EZ- Tech or PRO-LINK 9000 manual.

svcsubproc.title: Reading Flash Codes: ENGINE RUNNING PROCEDURE

note.para: All Caterpillar flash codes are two digit numbers.

step1.para: Start engine and allow to run at low idle for about 30 seconds.
Turn cruise on/off switch to off position.
Hold cruise set/resume switch in either position until codes begin to FLASH, then release.
The yellow Serv/Check Engine light will FLASH the first digit. At the end of the first digit there is a one or two second pause.
The yellow Serv/Check Engine light will FLASH the second digit. At the end of the second digit there will be a two or three second pause before the next fault code number is FLASHED.

The second and all successive fault codes will FLASH until all codes have been FLASHED. It will stop FLASHING after the last code has been flashed. To see the fault codes again, repeat steps 4 through 6.

Flash code 55 indicates that there are no logged diagnostic codes. For a listing of Caterpillar flash codes, refer to the Caterpillar Electronic Troubleshooting manual. Codes are also listed in the EZ-Tech or PRO-LINK 9000 manual.

svcsubproc.para: This section includes diagnostic tables for International installed circuits and components that are part of the Caterpillar electronic engine control system.

para.emph: To begin the process, refer to the appropriate Caterpillar Electronic Troubleshooting Manual and follow their directions.

svcsubproc.para: If the Caterpillar diagnostics indicate that a International circuit is suspect, use the diagnostic tables included in this section for a step-by-step procedure. Refer to the appropriate circuit diagram for CATERPILLAR C-10 or C-12 ENGINES IN CTS-5122W.
The EZ-Tech or PRO-LINK 9000 EST's with the Caterpillar programs can be used to read fault codes, customer and engine parameters and monitor various switches and sensors.
